titleStmt.title: The ingenious braggadocia who thinks to obliege by boasting of his large possessions, yet was very unwilling to lose much time in wooing; but being married, was in a weeks time acquainted with an aching forehead. To the tune of, Cook Laurel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray, & T. Passenger,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "I have a mare her colour is white,".
Date of publication suggested by Wing: [1678-80].
Printed in three columns, with woodcuts at head of first two. Verse lines in black letter; chorus lines in roman.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
